title: Visitor Center closure - Saturday, April 5, 2025
description: Due to inclement weather on Saturday, April 5, the site will close at 11:30 a.m. CST. Please travel safely, and thank you for your understanding.

description: Visitors may drive directly to the Bandelier Visitor Center, however, please be advised that parking may fill up and you may be turned around and asked to return later. Please call the Bandelier Visitor Center at (505) 672-3861 for more information.

description: Dennison Ferry Road and Day Use Area, Houchin Ferry Road and Campground, and the Green River Ferry Road from Mammoth Cave Parkway to Maple Springs Campground are closed due to high water conditions.

description: In April the visitor center will be open Wednesday - Sunday from 8:30am - 4:30pm. The Circle Trail is open from dawn to dusk 365 days a year. Restrooms are available on the northwest side of the building when the visitor center is closed.

title: April 6: Temporary Closure on Rock Creek and Potomac Parkway
description: From 6 am to 9 am, Rock Creek and Potomac Parkway will be closed from K Street to Virginia Avenue for a permitted event.

title: County-wide Burn Ban in Effect until April 15, 2025
description: In keeping with the county-wide burn ban enacted on January 15, fires--including charcoal fires--are not permitted within Amistad National Recreation Area. To read the Val Verde County Commissioners Court Order, click "More".

title: Diablo East Marina Cove and Walkway Access Are Closed
description: The Diablo East Marina Cove and walkway access are closed because of the presence of excessive docking material and unstable, loose ground. The area will reopen once these hazards have been corrected.

title: Green River Ferry Temporarily Closed Due to High Water and Debris
description: The Green River Ferry is temporarily closed due to high-water conditions and debris. For the most up to date information on the water levels at the Green River Ferry crossing, view the Daily Forecast for the Green River at Mammoth Cave National Park

title: Hike and Bike Day
description: On April 5, the Newton B. Drury Scenic Parkway will be closed to vehicles for the last "Hike and Bike Day" of the year.

description: The Grand Parade Trails are closed to dogs from April 1 to September 15 to protect breeding birds nesting in the meadows. Nesting songbirds see dogs as predators, which can stress the birds and lead to less productive or even failed nests.

description: From November 1 - April 15 annually, Isle Royale and its surrounding islands are closed to all visitors. Lake Superior waters are open to boaters. All islands reopen April 16. Call (906) 482-0984 to discuss trip planning, obtain permits, or pay fees.

description: The Old Orchard Museum & Visitor Center is open from 1-4:30PM Thursday, and 12-4:30PM Friday-Sunday. The latest tour reservation information is available on recreation.gov. Tickets are $15 Adults, $1 Child, and $7.50 Seniors.

description: Reservations are now open for Pulltite Campground! Group Sites 1-3 and Standard Sites 14-55 will be available starting on April 15, 2025. Sites are available by reservation only - book online at https://www.recreation.gov/camping/campgrounds/234357

title: South Unit temporarily closed south of Grand Teton Drive; Trailheads remain open.
description: The South Unit of Tule Springs Fossil Beds is temporarily closed to visitor access south of Grand Teton Drive, between Tule Springs Parkway and North Fifth Street in North Las Vegas for visitor safety during construction activities.

description: Fiery Furnace is temporarily closed. No ranger-led tours nor self-guided permits will be issued until further notice. We look forward to offering these services soon.

title: Green River Ferry Status
description: The Green River Ferry status can change without advanced warning. For the most up-to-date ferry status information call 270-758-2166 or follow the Mammoth Cave Roads and Ferry Twitter/X feed: @MCNPRoadsFerry

title: Playground in Pine Grove Picnic Area Closed
description: The park is improving accessibility at the playground in Pine Grove Picnic Area. During construction, until approximately the end of June 2025, the playground is closed and 10 nearby parking spaces will be used for construction vehicles only.

title: 3/25/2025: Work on the ramps to I-55 and the Parkway continues. Expect traffic delays.
description: Mill and overlay asphalt repair work continues on the ramps to I-55 resulting in nightly closures from 6:30 p.m. to 6 a.m. Closures move as work progresses. Crews are also working from milepost 101 to 102.5 during daylight hours.

title: Cunard Road delays
description: Cunard Road has been reopened. There is a section of one lane road with a traffic light. Through Memorial Day, expect delays of 3 to 5 minutes to get by this area.

title: Temporary Nighttime Closures for Deer Management
description: From March 5-April 15, 2025, the NPS may temporarily close select park areas or roads outside of park operating hours to conduct deer management operations. For more information see park deer management webpage.

title: Costly Outcome: Shark Island
description: Located near the Point of Cape Lookout, a sandbar has begun to connect, known as Shark Island, which lies outside of Cape Lookout's jurisdiction. The sand in this region is soft, making it difficult to navigate, increasing the risk of becoming stuck.

title: Waymeyer and Pin Oak River Access Temporarily Closed
description: Waymeyer and Pin Oak are blocked by a large number of fallen trees. The river access will be temporarily unavailable while crews clear the road.

title: Limited Visitor Center Services Monday and Tuesdays
description: Visitor Center access is limited to the foyer. Maps and information, Jr. Ranger program items, passport cancellation stamps, public restrooms, and water fountains are available.

title: Expect long lines to enter the park
description: Between March and November, particularly on busy holiday weekends, you may experience long lines at the entrance road. Parking lots at popular trailheads and viewpoints will fill early. Pack your patience and arrive early to avoid crowds.

title: Reduced picnic facilities throughout the park
description: Some trash cans and picnic tables have been removed to reduce maintenance workloads. We apologize for any inconvenience this causes.

title: Seip Earthworks Gate
description: Seip Earthworks is open to visitors and parking is available at the pull off near US 50, but a gated lane will be closed.  This closure will only last through the winter until approximately April, 2025. Call 740-774-1126 for more information.

title: Melrose Mansion Guided Tours
description: Reservations for guided tours of the mansion must be made on Recreation.gov. The tour is $11.00 and are at 10, 11, 2, 3, and 4; masks are optional. The estate is open daily from 8:30 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. The grounds and outbuildings are free.

title: Enter the Park with a full tank of gas!
description: While gas is available at Big Meadows Wayside (mile 51), supply is often limited, and visitors should fill up their tanks before entering the Park.

title: 2025 Firefly Viewing Event Lottery Dates Announced
description: Please see linked News Release for more details!

title: Warning! Very High Fire Danger!
description: Exercise extreme caution with any campfires. Campfires MUST be put out COLD to the touch with your hand.

title: Cold Springs Men's Restroom Closed For Repairs
description: The men's restroom between campsites 15 and 17 in Cold Springs is closed for repairs. The women's side remains open. The nearest available men's restroom is located across from campsite 5.

title: Northwest Perimeter Road Open
description: Northwest Perimeter Road is now accessible to visitors. Extensive cleanup and restoration efforts have been made following the EF 3 tornado that occurred on 4/27/2024. Please exercise good judgment and caution when driving or hiking through this area.

title: Hyde Street Pier Closure
description: Hyde Street Pier and access to historic ships will be closed to public until further notice starting 11/04/2024 in preparation for Hyde Street Pier renovation work.

title: Rose Farm Rehabilitation Project Closure Notice
description: As of May 2023, the Rose Farm & Rose Lane are closed to all visitation. The house will undergo a full rehabilitation. This work prohibits the use of the area around the house and lane during construction. Worker safety and resource protection are key.

title: David Wills House Closure
description: The David Wills House closed in October 2024 due to a burst water line and will remain closed for the remainder of 2025. No known reopening date is available. Please visit our David Wills House web page for more information and a 3D tour of the house.

title: New Park Hours
description: The park will be open to the public Thursday through Sunday, 11 a.m. to 3:30 p.m. Park buildings will begin to close at 3:00 p.m. Please plan your visit accordingly.

title: Glenmont and Glenmont Grounds Closed
description: The Glenmont estate grounds and mansion tours are currently closed to accomodate ongoing renovation work. Grounds passes will not be issued and house tours will not take place during this time. The Laboratory Complex remains open.

title: Skinners Falls River Access Closed
description: The Skinners Falls DEC River Access is closed to the public due to work PennDOT is doing on the Skinners Falls-Milanville Bridge. Please get off the river at the Damascus River Access or launch from the Narrowsburg or Darbytown River Accesses.

title: Limited Parking at Salt Pond Visitor Center
description: Due to paving activity in and around Salt Pond Visitor Center in Eastham, parking is LIMITED. Paving work is expected to last through April, weather depending.

title: Highway 12 Detour until Spring of 2025
description: The Minnechaduza Creek Bridge is currently closed for replacement. Traffic is detoured around the bridge using county road 906th. This impacts river visitors. Please contact Niobrara NSR staff for more information at 402-389-1925.

title: New Winter Hours
description: The Visitor Center will be open Wednesday - Saturday, 9:00 AM - 5:00 PM from December 1, 2024 to April 30, 2025. The Visitor Center will be closed Sundays, Mondays, and Tuesdays.

title: Carter Home and Garden Not Accessible to the Public
description: The Carter Home and Garden is not open to the public at this time. Please follow our official social media channels for updates on future access and opening plans.

title: No Indoor Facilities or Potties
description: We are without indoor facilities and do not have portable toilets at this time.

title: Voicemail Unavailable on main Park Line
description: Voicemail on the main park line is currently unavailable. Please use the contact function at the bottom of this page, and we will respond as quickly as possible.

title: Main Road Status
description: The main park road is open to Rainbow Point.

title: Busy Season, parking may be limited.
description: Saguaro NP is in its busy season for the year. This means increased visitation and more limited parking. The visitor center, trails, and picnic area parking lots will fill up fast. Plan ahead and have a backup trail in case a given parking lot is full.

title: Chatham Interior Closed for Maintenance Project
description: The interior of Chatham will be closed for a planned Maintenance project until further notice. The Chatham gate remains open 9 am-5 pm and the grounds remain open sunrise to sunset.

title: Phone lines down at Maggie L. Walker National Historic Site
description: Visitor Center and office phones are currently down. To contact the park, please use the email link at https://www.nps.gov/mawa/contacts.htm

title: 3/19/2025 Closure update for Chisha Foka Multi-Use trail rehabilitation
description: All of the trail north of Old Canton Road is open. The Choctaw Agency parking lot is closed and contractors are working on the sections of trail adjacent to it.

title: USS San Francisco Memorial Lot & El Camino Del Mar Permit Parking Monday - Friday 6am - 6pm
description: Park visitors may park in non-reserved spaces at Navy Lot. Veterans Affairs San Francisco Health Care System permit holders must park in the signed parking spaces. Parking permits in effect from 6am - 6pm, Monday through Friday, except federal holidays.

title: Valley Trail closed between Juniper Spur Trail and Holly Trail
description: The Valley Trail is closed between the Juniper Spur and Holly trails due to unsafe conditions, including a downed tree across the trail. Please abide by trail closure signs.

title: Minute Man phone lines will be off -line for several weeks, please use this email address
description: Due to an upgrade of internal phone systems at Minute Man, Visitor Center phones and office phone lines will be off-line for several weeks. Please reach out to the park via email with questions MIMA_Info@nps.gov

title: Preservation Work Along Trails
description: Starting March 18, preservationists restoring the bronze state plaques along the entrance road, and the War of 1812 commemorative markers in the Orpheus Grove. Some of these areas may be temporarily closed while work is in progress.

title: Historic carriage roads closed until further notice for "mud season"
description: Spring thaw has led to temporary closures to protect Acadia's historic carriage roads during "mud season." Walking, bicycling or riding horses in these wet and soft conditions can cause costly ruts and potholes that channel water and exacerbate erosion.

title: Several trails closed for Peregrine falcon nesting season
description: Until further notice, typically mid-August, Penobscot East Trail, Jordan Cliffs Trail, Precipice Trail, and Valley Cove Trail are closed for Peregrine falcon nesting season. Also, as roads reopen, the Precipice Trail parking lot will remain closed.

title: Bison Showing Extra Curiosity Recently
description: Bison graze in both Windmill and West Traps pastures. Some bison have exhibited a little more aggression lately. Bison will defend themselves if they feel threatened. Keep 100 yards distance. A raised tail is a warning sign:bison may charge or give chase.

title: Bison Will Soon Be in Calving Season -May
description: A reminder that bison are going about their normal life cycle, with moms being protective. A raised tail is a warning sign and the animal may charge or give chase. Please give a wide distance, at least 100 yards. You can also hike around Windmill Pasture.

title: Glover Archbold Trail detour
description: For visitor safety, the southern end of the Glover Archbold Trail is under an emergency closure until further notice due to aerial hazards. Please follow the posted detour along Foxhall Rd. / 44th St. NW / P St. NW.

title: Parking Lot near Picnic Area B2 Closed
description: The parking lot near picnic area B2 is currently closed due to a construction project to stabilize a nearby ravine.

title: For entrance fees, we accept digital passes and credit/debit cards
description: Digital passes or credit/debit cards are the ONLY method of payment at all fee collection areas. Pre-paid digital passes are available online and may be purchased in advance.

title: Equestrian Traffic Temporarily Prohibited Milepost 173.37 to 184.5
description: Horses are prohibited between Spring Gap (mile 173.37) and Cumberland (mile 184.5) due to recent and ongoing towpath resurfacing. See more for details.

title: Pa-Hay-Okee Overlook Trail closed for replacement project until Fall 2025
description: The Pa-Hay-Okee boardwalk trail, tower and parking lot will be closed for a replacement project until the fall. This is to replace aging infrastructure. The road remains open as a turnaround.

title: Paurotis Pond is closed for wading bird nesting season until Summer 2025
description: Paurotis Pond, including the boat launch, the pond, and the area beyond the parking area adjacent to the pond, is closed until further notice to limit human disturbance to nesting wading birds like Great Egrets. The parking lot remains open for viewing.

title: Bush Key is closed until Fall 2025
description: Bush Key (including the shoreline beyond the seaplane) is closed to support breeding and nesting activities colonies of Sooty Terns and Brown Noddies. The island will reopen in the fall.

title: Stage 1 Fire Restrictions
description: Stage 1 Fire Restrictions prohibit building, maintaining, attending, or using a fire, campfire, or stove fire, including charcoal and briquettes, outside a fire structure that is provided by the Forest Service within a Designated Area.

title: Storm Damage
description: Big Sandy Trail is CLOSED due to damage from Hurricane Beryl. Work is ongoing to repair damaged bridges and washouts.

title: Kīlauea Visitor Center (KVC) Closed for Extensive Renovation
description: The Welcome Center is now open at Kilauea Military Camp while the Kīlauea Visitor Center undergoes renovations. Park rangers and the Hawaiʻi Pacific Parks Association park store are available from 9 a.m. to 4:45 p.m. daily.

title: Most Park Roads Closed to All Vehicles
description: Spring plowing has begun and most roads are closed to all vehicles until mid-April. The road between the North and Northeast entrances remains open and is open year-round to regular vehicles.

title: Spring Canyon Seawall Replacement Project
description: Beginning Sunday afternoon, March 16, 2025, the lower parking lot at the Spring Canyon boat launch will close for the boat launch seawall replacement. The boat launch will remain open, but dock access will be limited. The upper parking lot will be open.

title: High Fire Danger Alert
description: The park and surrounding area are currently under a high fire danger alert. As a reminder, open flames are NOT allowed in the park. Thank you for helping preserve and protect YOUR national park!

title: Park Hours Beginning March 23rd, 2025
description: Starting Sunday, March 23, 2025, John Muir National Historic Site will be closed on Sundays and Mondays. The site will be open Tuesday through Saturday from 10:00 AM to 5:00 PM

title: Horse Trail Closed
description: The Horse Trail will be temporarily closed as normal in the spring due to muddy and soft trail conditions. Please help us preserve the park's natural and cultural resources by not riding in the park until further notice.

description: Cheeseboro Canyon maintenance from March 17 – May 30, 2025, on Ranch Center Rd. will have large vehicles/heavy equipment. Trail closed: Weekdays from 8 AM to 5 PM. Open: Evenings and weekends. Work may be extended to late June if delayed by weather.

description: Olympic National Park will begin restoring essential services to the Hoh Rain Forest once the Upper Hoh Road, which is maintained by Jefferson County, is safe for travel. Until then, the area is closed to all traffic, including pedestrians & bicycles.

title: Parking on Adams Street Temporarily Limited/Unavailable
description: Due to construction on Adams St, street parking at the Old House may be limited or unavailable. Validated parking is available at 44 Saville Ave, 0.5 miles from the Old House. The historic homes remain closed for the winter season. Park grounds are open.

description: Visitors should exercise caution when hiking areas of the park that have opened since Hurricane Helene. Hazards on trails and in forested areas such as hanging tree limbs, debris on the ground, and washed-out sections of trails and bridges are possible.

description: The floodplain forest between the Connecticut River and NH Route 12A, north of the Blow-Me-Down Brook and forested areas on either side of Saint-Gaudens Road are closed to prevent damage from fiddlehead poaching during the months of April and May.

title: Get Skyline Drive Status Updates

title: Expect Trail Repair Delays
description: Be aware of delays and hazards on trails as crews remove downed trees and repair trails from the winter storm events.

title: Road Construction Projects
description: Parkway areas closed for ongoing road maintenance and construction projects.

title: Blue Basin Overlook Trail Closed
description: The 3.25 - mile Blue Basin Overlook trail in the Sheep Rock unit is closed until further notice. A mudslide and trail washouts have created unsafe conditions for hiking. The shorter 1.3- mile Island In Time trail remains open.

title: Flooding in Fort Massachusetts
description: Fort Massachusetts has been experiencing periodic flooding due to recent rain storms, causing park staff to close the fort for periods of time until the water recedes. Park staff will assess fort conditions daily and open the fort when conditions allow.

title: William M. Colmer Visitor Center MS Closure
description: The William M. Colmer visitor center will be closed on Mondays and Tuesdays until further notice.

title: Hours of Operation
description: The Visitor Center is closed on Wednesdays and Thursdays and open Fridays through Tuesdays from 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. Park grounds are open daily from sunrise to sunset.

description: The Visitor Center, Engine House 6 Exhibit Shelter and the Lemon House are closed on Wednesdays and Thursdays and open Fridays through Tuesdays from 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. Park grounds are open daily from sunrise to sunset.

title: Starting April 28, 2025, the park will be closed Monday through Thursday
description: Starting April 28, 2025, the park will be closed Monday through Thursday to ensure the safety of visitors during construction projects. Open Friday, Saturday, and Sunday. Visitors can expect this closure to last through the 2025 summer season.

title: Main Phone Line Out of Order
description: The Parks main phone line is currently out of service. The Visitor Center and Offices can be contacted at 432-426-3816 or 432-426-3094

title: Operating Hours
description: The seashore is currently operating on summer hours of 6:00 AM - 8:00 PM. Last entry into the seashore is at 7:00 pm.

title: Thompson Lane and Stones River National Cemetery Gates Open at 9 AM on Weekends
description: Beginning March 9, 2025, the park entrance gates at 1563 North Thompson Lane and Stones River National Cemetery will open at 9 AM on Saturdays and Sundays. We apologize for any inconvenience this action may cause.

title: Visitor Center Theaters Under Construction
description: The theaters in the Lincoln Borglum Visitor Center are closed until late-May 2025 for renovations. The park movie is showing in the Carvers' Cafe daily 8:00am until 5:15pm. The visitor center and exhibit hall remain open during renovations.

title: Main Visitor Restrooms Under Construction
description: The main restrooms at the park entrance are under construction until mid-May. There are portable toilets available at the entrance, restrooms in the Carvers' Cafe from 8am-5:30pm daily, and in the Lincoln Borglum Visitor Center while park grounds are open

title: U.S. side of Chilkoot National Historic Trail to Open as far as Mile 4
description: No public access on the U.S. side of the Chilkoot Trail past mile 4.0. Permitted overnight camping is only for the Canadian side of the Trail – Reservations will open in May for the 2025 hiking season.

title: Sloat Blvd. parking lot at Ocean Beach closed starting March 17, 2025
description: The parking lot will be closed through mid-April as part of a city-managed project. For more information, please see the project page (link below).

title: Visitor Center Closed for the Winter Season
description: The visitor center is now closed for the season. Due to limited staffing, we are unable to offer tours till we reopen in the summer. For more information, please call 530-667-8119 or email us at tule_information@nps.gov.

title: U.S. Navy Blue Angels Practices
description: On Tuesdays and Wednesdays from April to October, parking lots at Fort Pickens Area fill early. Vehicles parked in non-designated spots are subject to citation and towing. When lots are full, the area will close to incoming traffic. Plan ahead.

title: Fort Donelson NB Road Access on Spring Schedule Beginning Sunday March 9, 2025
description: From March 9 through May 25, 2025, vehicles may access park roads from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm for the Spring season. Pedestrian Access remains from sunrise to sunset.

title: Visitor Center Closed Tuesdays & Wednesdays – Opening at 11 AM Sundays
description: Beginning on March 9, 2025, the visitor center will open at 11 AM on Sundays and be closed on Tuesdays and Wednesdays. Restrooms will be open daily from 9 AM to 5 PM.

description: AQUA is replacing an outdated water main along Rte 23. From Mon. Mar 3 through Fri. Apr 25, 9 AM to 3 PM, Rte 23 is scheduled to be closed and detoured weekdays at the intersection with Rte 252. Click below for more information from PennDOT.

title: Closures Due to Flood Damage
description: Some areas of the park including Walnut Canyon Desert Drive and some trails remain closed after extensive flood damage. The main park road to the visitor center and cavern is open.

title: Belmont-Paul Women's Equality NM exterior lift out of order

description: The Visitor and Education Center in Eads, Colorado is closed until further notice. The Center for Sand Creek Massacre Studies is available for appointment only research requests.

title: Mica View Trail work
description: Resurfacing of Mica View Trail has been postponed due to material delays. This project is a high priority & we will resume work as soon as we are able. The trail will remain open as we wait, though surfacing work has already begun. Proceed with caution.

title: Vehicle Break-Ins
description: Saguaro National Park is an urban park. Vehicle break-ins have occurred at trailheads around the park. Don't make yourself a target. Leave valuables at home, secure your vehicle, and report any suspicious activity.

title: Folger Park Closed for Rehabilitation
description: The park is expected to reopen in winter 2025.

title: Fort Moultrie Dock Closure
description: The Fort Moultrie Dock, Picnic Area, and Bench by the Road memorial are inaccessible from now until spring of 2026 due to a dock replacement project. An alternate picnic area along the sidewalk toward the General Moultrie Grave has been established.

title: Visitor Center Closed
description: The Salt River Bay NHP&EP Visitor Contact station remains closed due to damage caused by Hurricanes Irma/Maria. Reconstruction of the Visitor Contact Station continues.

title: Reds Meadow Road and Devils Postpile National Monument are closed for the season
description: Reds Meadow Road, which provides access to Devils Postpile National Monument, is closed for the season, with a planned reopening on July 3, 2025.

title: Hike and Bike Day: Newton B. Drury Scenic Parkway
description: The 1st Saturday of each month October through May the Newton B. Drury Scenic Parkway will be closed to vehicle traffic to allow for a hike and bike day. This is a great opportunity to walk your pets through the redwoods along this scenic road.

title: Warning: HIGH VISITATION 3/1-5/26. Please Read ALERT in Full
description: During High Visitation, Expect LONG LINES and LIMITED PARKING. RVS and Trailers should use overflow parking along road or unhitch before visiting. Busses should drop off passengers ONLY. Please pay online before visit and have passes/IDs ready.

title: First Amendment Area
description: The primary designated First Amendment area is the grassy area directly Infront of the headquarters building at 81 Carl Sandburg Lane. This area is available for small groups of 25 or less on a “first come, first served” basis.

title: Temporary Closures for Peregrine Nesting
description: The following established climbing management areas are closed to all public use from March 1, 2025 to July 15, 2025 to protect peregrine falcon nesting aeries: Newhalem Crag East and Newhalem Crag West (Ryan’s Wall).

title: Campground Closures
description: All campgrounds are closed until further notice.

title: Ocean Beach Fire Season in Effect through October 31, 2024
description: Fires allowed ONLY in park provided concrete firepits between Stairwells 15 and 20. Do NOT make fire rings using rocks, logs or other items. For more information, visit the beach fire regulations link below.

title: Seasonal Operations Change
description: we will operating on a winter schedule. Check out this link https://www.nps.gov/gois/planyourvisit/things2do.htm. Always check this website for alerts and schedules changes For safety reason no tours will be conducted w/temps below 35 degrees

title: Feral Dogs May Be Seen in Organ Pipe Cactus National Monument
description: Feral dogs may be present at the Twin Peaks Campground and around the Kris Eggle Visitor Center. Visitors should not attempt to feed or water these dogs or approach them in any way as they may carry disease or become hostile.

title: Operating Hours
description: Starting Tuesday March 4th, 2025: Site Open for Public Tours Fridays and Saturdays. Tour times can be checked on park calendar.

title: Campground Reservation Changes
description: As of January 1, 2025, ALL developed campsites will be available through reservation ONLY. These include Pulltite, Round Spring, Alley Spring, Big Spring, Two Rivers, and Akers. Reservations must be made through recreation.gov (online or by calling).

title: Small void at Wahinekapu (Steaming Bluff)
description: A steam vent about 3 inches wide has opened in the ground near the overlook at Wahinekapu/Steaming Bluff and is emitting scalding hot steam. A small area near the overlook is roped off for safety.

title: Towpath and Valley trails south of Red Lock
description: Trails will be temporarily closed between Red Lock Trailhead and Brandywine Creek from Monday, March 3, to Friday, May 2, 2025 for installation of a new Brandywine Creek culvert. No detour is available.

title: Fairbanks Center Operational Changes
description: The Fairbanks Alaska Public Lands Information Center will be closed Saturdays and Sundays. At this time, we are unable to accommodate mail requests for information. If you have questions or an urgent need, please contact us at (907) 459-3730.

title: Water Unavailable at Hensley Settlement effective November 19, 2024
description: To prevent freezing of and subsequent damage to pipes, all water at Hensley Settlement has been turned off. Hikers should plan accordingly and carry in sufficient amounts. Any water collected from streams must be purified.

title: No Hunting Allowed in Castle Mountains National Monument
description: Hunting is illegal in Castle Mountains National Monument

title: Use Caution on Roads with Debris
description: Flooding has resulted in debris along many roads within the park boundaries. Please use caution when driving on paved roads and watch for road crews at work. Be aware that unimproved and dirt roads may be impassible due to washouts, so plan accordingly.

title: Most Monument Roads Require Heavy Duty 4WD Vehicle to Travel Safely
description: Breaking down in the remote monument can be a life-threatening emergency. Most roads require a well-equipped, heavy-duty 4WD vehicle to travel. 2WD high clearance vehicles must use Walking Box Ranch Rd for entry and exit. No Visitor Facilities Available.

title: Pinnacle Overlook restrooms closed for the winter
description: Starting November 15th, there will be no water or restrooms at Pinnacle Overlook for the remainder of the 2024 fall and winter season.

title: Remaining Impacts from Hurricane Helene
description: Some impacts remain from Hurricane Helene. Go to our Alerts & Conditions page for current information on impacts to trails and facilities.

title: Icy Conditions - Please Use Extreme Caution
description: Temperatures remain below freezing. Walkways are covered in thick ice and blowing snow. Please use caution in parking lot and on trails.

title: Cholla Cactus Garden Closure
description: Cholla Cactus Garden Trail will be closed daily from December 2024 - April 2025 to improve the conditions of the loop trail.

title: De Soto National Memorial Reopening
description: DeSoto National Memorial is currently closed due to impacts from 2024 Hurricanes. The parking lot and berm area of the park will be reopening Saturday, February 22. There will be no restrooms available yet. Park trails are still being repaired.

title: Pardon Our Dust: Chisos Basin Improvement Projects to Begin in July
description: Work on two large construction projects in the Chisos Basin will begin in July 2025 and continue for approximately two years. Major disruptions in visitor access to the Chisos Basin are expected during this time. Big Bend National Park will remain OPEN.

title: Ice on Paths
description: Driveway and paths are slippery due to snow and ice. Please exercise caution.

title: Overseer's House and Dovecote Restrooms Temporarily Closed
description: Due to power outages related to building maintenance, the Overseer's House (Farmhouse) and the restrooms inside the dovecote are currently closed. The Quarters of the Enslaved, dairy and grounds are open. The mansion side of the park is unaffected.

title: Hozomeen Gate Remains Closed
description: Until further notice, the gate at Hozomeen will remain closed; vehicle and foot traffic across the US/Canada border is prohibited. Visitors must enter through a designated port of entry.

title: Contact Us
description: During the off-season, please contact us via our email address: boha_information@nps.gov

title: Washington Monument is closed for maintenance one day each month
description: Closures for 2025: Mon, Jan. 6, Thu., Jan. 9; Mon., Jan. 20; Thu., March 13; Wed., Apr. 16; Wed., May 14; Wed., June 4; Mon., July 14; Mon., Aug. 4; Mon., Sept. 15., Wed. Oct 8., Thurs. Nov 6., and Dec 11. The monument is also closed on July 4 and Dec 25.

title: Washington Monument and Old Post Office Tower closed one day each month for maintenance
description: Closures for 2025: Mon, Jan. 6, Thu., Jan. 9; Mon., Jan. 20; Thu., March 13; Wed., Apr. 16; Wed., May 14; Wed., June 4; Mon., July 14; Mon., Aug. 4; Mon., Sept. 15., Oct 8., Nov 6., and Dec 11. The monument is also closed on July 4 and Dec. 25.

title: Trail Maintenance Work on the River and Chapel Trails in 2025
description: Ongoing maintenance work on River Trail between Betzwood and parking lot on Pawlings Rd and on Chapel Trail west of the Chapel, taking place in 2025. Trails to remain open to visitors. Trail users should exercise extra caution and follow safety warnings.

title: Temporary Road Closures can Occur in Winter
description: While the majority of park roads remain open, these three sometimes temporarily close to vehicles due to winter weather: Crystal Creek Road, Mill Creek Road, and Peltier Valley Road from Brandy Creek Road.

title: Park Remains Open to Visitors: Some Buildings Closed due to Long-Term Repairs
description: The History Museum, Roundhouse, Locomotive Cutaway Exhibit, Railyard, and grounds are open to visitors. The Visitor Center, Theatre, and Technology Museum remain closed until long-term repairs to our heating and cooling system are made.

title: Clinton Street Pedestrian Gate Closed
description: The Clinton Street pedestrian gate is currently closed. All access to the park is through the main entrance on Emery Hwy.

title: Site Closure Beginning July 8, 2024
description: Update October 23: The Edgar Allan Poe National Historic Site remains closed for a utilities improvement project. Continue to check back for a late Spring 2025 reopening date.

title: William O'Brien State Park Boat Ramp Closed
description: William O'Brien State Park boat ramp and day use area are closed until early 2025. For more information, contact William O'Brien State Park at 651-539-4980 or by visiting mndnr.gov.

title: West Lot Closure
description: The West Lot will be closed to public access after 3:30 PM on weekdays, all day weekends, and all federal holidays. East Lot will be open and available for parking to facilitate park access.

title: Reds Meadow Road Access Restrictions in 2025
description: Reds Meadow Road and shuttle service, which provide access to Devils Postpile, will only be open Fridays–Sundays (and on Thursdays with one-hour delays in July and August). The road will tentatively open for the season on July 3 and close October 6, 2025.

title: Park in Progress! Visitor center to close temporarily
description: Beginning Monday, February 10, the visitor center will temporarily close to the public through June for construction. All other park facilities remain open for visitation.

title: Harbor Bay Main Boat Ramp is Closed Due to Low Water
description: Harbor Bay Main Boat Ramp is now closed due to low water levels.

title: Downed Trees on Trails
description: Please be cautions on all trails and side roads as high winds and heavy snow have caused several downed trees throughout the park.

title: Niobrara NSR Phones Down
description: Niobrara NSR phones are currently down. You may call 402-389-1925 or email niobrara_nsr@nps.gov to reach park staff.

title: List of trail closures post-Hurricane Helene
description: Many closures remain on the Trail following Hurricane Helene's devastation. This will remain true for the foreseeable future. Visit the Appalachian Trail Conservancy (ATC) website for an up-to-date list of closures. OBSERVE ALL CLOSURES. Stay safe!

title: Ranger Station closed for renovations
description: The Ranger Station located in the Cabin District is currently closed for renovations.

title: Many park roads are closed for the winter season.
description: Many park roads are closed for the winter season, including White River, Sunrise, Mowich Lake, Stevens Canyon, Westside Road, and SR410/123.

title: Kelso Depot Visitor Center Closed
description: Kelso Depot Visitor Center is closed for rehabilitation of the heating and cooling system. We expect to reopen the depot in 2026. The restrooms beside the depot are open.

title: Rough and Damaged Roads
description: Please drive slowly and exercise due caution when driving in Mojave National Preserve. Rough and damaged roads exist on both paved and unpaved roads. Watch for potholes.

title: Closed trail bridge at Zion Lodge (Shuttle Stop #5)
description: To access Emerald Pools, start your hike at the Grotto (Shuttle Stop #6). This does not affect other trailheads or the Zion Canyon Shuttle System.

title: Quarry Exhibit Hall Temporary Closure in Fall 2025
description: The Quarry Exhibit Hall with the "Wall of Bones" will be temporarily closed from September 8, 2025, to late October 2025 for a major road, parking lot, and sidewalk reconstruction project. There will be no visitor access to the fossils in the building.

title: Vehicle Length & Trailer Restrictions
description: No large vehicle turnaround after Faraway Ranch Parking Lot (1 mile after entrance). Vehicles over 29 feet park at Faraway. Disconnect trailers at Faraway. Trailers with campground reservations proceed directly to camp.

title: Phones Down at the Tuskegee Airmen National Historic Site
description: For any general inquiries, visitors can contact Ranger Myia Patterson at (334) 421-0340. For reservations to visit the Tuskegee Airmen National Historic Site, please call Ranger Sheryl Buchanan at (334) 421-3246

title: Many Glacier Construction Closure
description: Due to extremely limited parking during construction in the Swiftcurrent area, personal vehicle access into Many Glacier will be restricted from July 1-September 21, 2025. A temporary shuttle service will be provided for hikers wanting to access the area.

title: Gas Pumps at Panamint Springs Resort are Closed at Night
description: Gasoline is available at Panamint Springs Resort from 7am-9:30pm, daily. Gas is available at Furnace Creek and Stovepipe Wells 24hrs.

title: Herbert Hoover NHS is Open. The Presidential Library and Museum is Closed for Renovations
description: The Herbert Hoover Presidential Library and Museum is closed to museum visitors with plans to reopen in 2026. The Research Room will remain open by appointment, and educational programming will continue during the renovation.

title: Equestrian Trail Update 1/24/2025
description: An equestrian bridge on the north side of the park is also closed. All other equestrian trails are open.

title: Trail update 1/24/2025
description: Most trails are open and ready for the public. Those that remain closed are the Charleston Road/ Goudey Trail past the Cherokee Path and the portion of Cherokee Path between the stockade fort and the Charleston Road.

title: Davis Bayou Area Closures
description: The Nature Way Trail boardwalk behind the visitor center.

title: Jamestown Island Loop Roads Closed
description: Due to repairs taking place, The Jamestown Island Loop Drive is closed to all visitors, including pedestrians, cyclists, and vehicle traffic. The Island Loop Drive will reopen when it is safe to do so, likely in the Spring of 2025.

title: Perdido Key Area Closures
description: The Perdido Key kayak launch and parking lot will be closed. The Perdido Key Discovery Trail and boardwalk are also closed for construction.

title: Prospectus for Passenger Ferry Service to the South Core Banks and Shackleford Banks and Land Transp
description: Find more information for concession business opportunity to provide passenger ferry service to the South Core Banks and Shackleford Banks and land transportation on the South Core Banks at https://www.nps.gov/subjects/concessions/cc-calo001-26.htm

title: Dipsea Trail Footbridge Closed for Season
description: The Dipsea Trail footbridge crossing Redwood Creek has been removed for the season. Please detour via the Deer Park Fire Road and Muir Woods Road. This closure does not impact the main trails in Muir Woods.

title: Cave Mountain Road Temporary Closure
description: Newton County Road 5, also known as Cave Mountain Road, will be closed Mondays - Thursdays from 8am - 4pm for road improvements. The road will be open Fridays - Sundays to all traffic.

title: Limited parking validation for HCID garage
description: Beginning February 10, the Boott Cotton Mills Museum visitor entrance at 115 John Street is the only location for parking validation for the HCID garage. The museum is a 3/4 mile walk from the garage. Validation is only available during museum hours.

title: Old Post Office Tower closed one day each month for maintenance
description: Closures for 2025: Mon, Jan. 6, Thu., Jan. 9; Mon., Jan. 20; Thu., March 13; Wed., Apr. 16; Wed., May 14; Wed., June 4; Mon., July 14; Mon., Aug. 4; Mon., Sept. 15. The monument is also closed on July 4 and Dec. 25.

title: Stage II Fire Restrictions
description: Stage II Fire Restrictions will be in effect beginning Tuesday, January 21, 2025. Due to high fire danger, El Morro will implement Stage II Fire Restrictions. These include no campfires. No smoking except in an enclosed vehicle or other authorized area.

title: Reception Center Rehabilitation Project
description: The Eisenhower Reception Center is undergoing a rehabilitation construction project in 2025. This will not impact visitors' ability to tour the Eisenhower home. For more, click here.

title: Icy Roads - Please Use Caution!
description: The open roads in the park have lots of icy patches. Please drive slowly and with caution. All Oregon Chain Laws apply.

title: Temporary Closure at Hawk Hill for Phase 3 of Site Improvement Project
description: Portions of hilltop will be closed while workers rehabilitate the Battery Commander Station and improve site conditions. Work is expected to be completed in December 2025. See project webpage for more info.  Please stay out of closed areas.

title: Anchoring Permit Not Required
description: Anchoring is allowed without a permit in the designated location on the west side of Buck Island. Updated permitting procedures for 2025 will be announced this winter. Check back for updates.

title: Temporary Trail Closure to Protect Nesting Falcons
description: From February 1st through May 31st, a portion of the East Rim Trail in the Chisos Mountains will be closed to protect nesting falcons. The closure includes East Rim backpacking campsites ER-4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9. For details and a map, click "more."

title: Temporary bridge removal on North Shore Quinault Rd
description: The temporary bridge on N Shore Quinault Road was removed for the winter on 10/23/2024. This split the Quinault Loop Drive into two out and back roads. Crews will reassess the area before reinstalling the bridge when the winter weather subsides.

title: America the Beautiful Passes Temporary Unavailable
description: At this time all sales of America the Beautiful Passes are temporary unavailable. Please check https://store.usgs.gov/recreational-passes for locations. We will advise when passes are available for sale. We apologize for any inconvenience.

title: Bridge Closure on Sunflower Road
description: Big Sandy Creek Unit: The bridge over Big Sandy Creek on Sunflower Road is closed for construction.

title: Cold Water Mandatory Life Jacket Wear
description: The Cold Water Mandatory Life Jacket Wear is in effect between November 1 - April 30. Everyone, regardless of age, is required to wear a Coast Guard-approved life jacket (PFD) if they are on the water in a boat, canoe, kayak, or other aquatic vessel.

title: Boca Chita Historic District
description: Work on the Boca Chita Lighthouse will begin Monday 01/20/2025.  During this project the lighthouse will be closed to the public and scaffolding will be erected temporarily obscuring views of this iconic landmark.  Updates will be provided when available.

title: Delays up to 1 hour are possible at Kelbaker Road Railroad Crossing near Kelso Depot
description: In the event there are train siding operations at the crossing near Kelso Depot, delays may be up to one hour. Please plan accordingly for this possibility with extra fuel and drinking water. Union Pacific Contact: 1 800 848-8715

title: Icy conditions
description: George Rogers Clark National Historical Park has received significant snowfall, please be careful on streets and sidewalks as some spots may be icy.

title: Apertura retrasada hoy, 10 de enero debido a mal tiempo
description: Debido a condiciones del tiempo y riesgos elevados por la mañana, el parque abrirá en retraso a las 9 am el viernes, 10 de enero. Esperamos seguir las horas de atención regulares en el Centro Cultural, pero retrasos o cierres tempranos son posibles.

title: Delassus-Kern House and Grounds Closed
description: Due to hazardous conditions, the Delassus-Kern House and grounds are closed indefinitely.

title: Reopening of Lower Cliff Dwelling
description: On Saturday January 11, 2025, the Lower Cliff Dwelling will reopen for full visitation.

title: 4th Annual Winter Lecture Series Rescheduled to Begin January 18, 2025.
description: Due to an additional Winter Storm Warning for Friday, January 17, 2025, the first speaker program for Camp Nelson National Monument's 4th Annual Winter Lecture Series has been pushed to the next Saturday, January 18.

title: Uber, Lyft, and Taxi Services
description: Taxi and ride-share services are often not available in Pecos. Even if services like Uber and Lyft will bring you here, it can be very difficult to secure a ride out. Please ensure you have a departure plan in place before being dropped off at Pecos.

title: Temporary change to park phone number
description: The park's phone number has temporarily changed. Please call 540-682-0173.

title: Meriam's Corner parking lot to close for several weeks
description: Beginning Monday January 13, the parking area at Meriam's Corner will be closed to vehicles for the staging of construction materials. The closure will last several weeks Please use alternate parking lots across the park.

title: Avoid Water Recreation Under and Around Skinners Falls-Milanville Bridge
description: River users are strongly encouraged to avoid travelling and recreating under and around the Skinners Falls-Milanville Bridge due to work PennDOT is doing on the bridge. Please take out at the Damascus River Access instead of Skinners Falls River Access.

title: Casa Grande Ruins Picnic Area Closed for Improvements
description: The picnic area at Casa Grande Ruins will close from Monday, November 18, 2024, until mid-March 2025 for improvements to the accessible ramp and observation platform.  Call for information on any partial openings that may happen during this time.

title: Timed Entry Reservation Pilot 2025
description: To enter the park April 1–July 6 and August 28–October 31, 2025, most visitors will need a Timed Entry Ticket. Tickets may be purchased from Recreation.gov up to six months ahead. Starting March 31, extra tickets will release at 7pm for next-day visits.

title: Harpers Corner Road Closure
description: The Harpers Corner Road is closed to vehicles for the winter season at the Plug Hat Butte gate, 5 miles north of HWY 40. Temporary closures south of Plug Hat Butte may occur as needed for snow clearing.

title: Going-to-the-Sun Road Seasonal Closure
description: The Going-to-the-Sun Road is closed for the season at Lake McDonald Lodge on the west side and 1.5 miles west of St. Mary Visitor Center on the east side. Winter weather may change these locations at any time.

title: Paces Mill Closed for Planned Rehabilitation Project
description: Paces Mill will be closed until May 2025 with no access to parking, facilities, or the canoe launch. The last park boat ramp south of US-41 is open with limited, non-parking vehicle access for take-out. Plan to exit the river before Paces!

title: Val-Kill Cottage Tours
description: Val-Kill Cottage is now closed until Spring 2025. A date for re-opening is TBD. The grounds remain open every day according to All Park Hours. In the event of inclement weather, the gates will remain closed.

title: Phones Not Working
description: The phones at Arkansas Post National Memorial are not currently working. To contact us, please use this email address: arpo_information@nps.gov. Sorry for any inconvenience.

title: Municipal Pier Permanent Closure
description: Municipal Pier is closed permanently. After a safety review with the U.S. Public Health Service, it was determined that the deterioration of Municipal Pier in Aquatic Park Cove is unsafe for public use.

title: Pay fees by credit/debit card only.
description: Only credit or debit cards are accepted for all cave tour and campground fees. Entrance to Oregon Caves National Monument and Preserve is free, but cave access is only available with a guide.

title: Thomas Stone National Historic Site closed for winter season.
description: Thomas Stone National Historic Site is closed for the winter season. There is no public access to park grounds and facilities.

title: Park Movie
description: Due to technical difficulties, the captioning on our park movie is not currently working and the lighting is not consistently dimming in the site's theater. For a captioned version, you can visit www.nps.gov/fosc/learn/photosmultimedia/fsmvideos.htm

title: Some Park Buildings are Temporarily Closed for Maintenance
description: Some park buildings are temporarily closed to clean up after the Fire Suppression System replacement. Closed are Officer's Quarters #1 & #2, some of the Post Headquarters, and some of the Dragoon Barracks, A virtual tour link below.

title: Visitor Center Open at 419 Decatur Street
description: The New Orleans Jazz NHP & Jean Lafitte NHP&P have a combined French Quarter Visitor Center at 419 Decatur Street. Open Tuesdays through Saturdays, 9:30 am to 4:30 pm. Calendar for events: https://www.nps.gov/jazz/planyourvisit/calendar.

title: Approximately three-tenths-of-a-mile stretch of beach in Buxton temporarily closed due to hazards
description: An approximately three-tenths-of-a-mile long stretch of beach, and adjacent parking lot, in Buxton is temporarily closed due to petroleum contamination and remnant military infrastructure.

title: Visitor Center Closure
description: The Visitor Center will be CLOSED Mondays and Tuesdays. Park grounds and trails will remain open sunrise to sunset daily, as will restrooms. Passport stamps are always available on the Visitor Center porch.

title: Parking Reservations Always Required - See "Know Before You Go" for Details
description: Reservations are required for all personal vehicles and shuttle riders at Muir Woods. You can make your reservation by visiting www.gomuirwoods.com. Visit our "Know Before You Go" webpage to learn more important details before your visit.

title: George Washington Carver Museum Closed for Restoration
description: The George Washington Carver Museum will remain closed until restoration completion, tentatively early 2025. The Oaks, Home of Booker T. Washington is open Tuesday-Thursday by reservation only.

title: Reduced Winter Services in Effect
description: The winter maintenance plan is in effect for the season beginning January 2, 2024. Certain roads and areas may be closed or may not receive winter maintenance. Visit the Current Conditions page for more information.

title: The Brick House Currently Closed
description: The Perkins’ historic family home known as the Brick House is currently closed to visitors for a restoration project. It is anticipated to reopen in summer of 2025. The grounds remain open.

title: Icy Conditions
description: Intermittent morning/evening frost & ice along walkways, bridges, & in the parking lot make many areas around the Great Falls extremely slippery. Please use caution while walking around the park. Click 'more' for a winter safety video with additional tips

title: Park trails have been impacted by winter storms.
description: Numerous trails throughout the park have been reported by park staff and/or visitors as flooded or as blocked by fallen trees. Please report fallen trees to 415-464-5100 x2 x5. Check out our Trail Advisories and Closures page for more information.

title: Reconstructed Fort Temporarily Closed
description: The reconstructed fort is temporarily closed to allow park staff to address critical safety hazards. Park grounds and trails are still open.

title: Lookout Mountain Wildland Fire Prompts Closure of Mountain Beautiful Trail
description: Due to the effects of a wildland fire on the eastern slope of Lookout Mountain, the park's Mountain Beautiful Trail will remain closed until further notice.

title: John Fitzgerald Kennedy NHS Closed for the Off Season until Late-May 2025
description: The JFK birthplace is closed for the season and will reopen in late-May 2025. During the off season, tours are only offered by appointment on Wednesdays and Fridays, with two weeks advanced notice, staffing and weather dependent.

title: Campfires permitted in fire rings only
description: Campfires are permitted only in designated fire rings. If there is a county burn ban, fire is prohibited in the park.

title: Cosby Entrance Road closed for construction
description: Rehabilitation began on December 9 for the 2.3-mile-long Cosby Entrance Road from TN State Route 32 to the gate of Cosby Campground. While crews are working, the entrance road is closed to the public. The work is projected to be completed in spring 2025.

title: Stay alert for maintenance and project work on golf course
description: For your safety, please obey signs and keep away from active work zones on the Rock Creek Park Golf Course.

title: Miles Creston Road Project now open to traffic.
description: Miles Creston from Highway 2 to Copenhaver Road is currently a gravel roadway but will be hard surfaced in the late spring of 2025. Miles Creston is a main access to Lincoln Mill, Hawk Creek, and Seven Bays.

title: Important Visitor Information – Screening Process in Effect
description: This is a new national park within an active military installation, which includes the current home of the US Army War College. There are no visitor services at this time. Please check back in the spring of 2025 for updates.

title: Park Phone Lines Are Down
description: The main Park phone lines are not operational due to damage from the Hurricanes. For all park inquiries and information please dial extension 102 at the main phone menu.

title: Monocacy National Battlefield Museum Closed
description: The museum at the Monocacy National Battlefield visitors center is closed for renovation until late spring 2025! We apologize for any inconvenience this may cause; the visitors center itself will remain open during this period for visitor use.

title: Loop Road and North Entrance Seasonal Closures
description: The Loop Road and North Entrance are closed to motorized vehicles for the winter starting 11/4. These areas are accessible by foot, bike, ski, and snowshoe. Restrooms and campsites are accessible but not maintained in the off-season. Learn more below.

title: Road to Lava Point and West Rim Trailhead closed
description: This is a regular, seasonal closure, and we will remove this alert when snow melts. Lava Point Overlook is also closed.

title: Park Unable to Receive Phone Messages
description: At this time, phone messages cannot be left at the visitor center. Please email the park at moca_tuzi_info@nps.gov or call during operating hours if you need to contact the park.

title: Water Fountains and Select Restrooms- Closed for Season
description: The water fountain at the Picnic Area and Memorial Area have been closed for winter. Picnic Area Restrooms and Beach Restroom have been closed for winter. They will reopen in Spring 2025.

title: West Auto Tour Closed
description: The West Auto Tour is closed for the season.

title: Ongoing Closure Notices
description: Devils Island dock and campsites, West Bay Club on Sand Island, and the trail on Stockton Island between Presque Isle Bay and Quarry Bay are closed. These closures affect only a small portion of the Lakeshore. Enjoy your visit.

title: Closure on Joyce Road NW for bridge replacement
description: Joyce Road NW is closed from the entrance of Rock Creek Park Golf Course to Missouri Ave NW while the bridge over Luzon Branch is replaced. Detours will be in place during the closure period.

title: Winter Road Closures
description: Sand Point Road is the only road maintained by the park in the winter. All other park roads, including Miners Castle Road and Chapel Road are not plowed within the park boundary.

title: Tioga Road (Highway 120 through the park) and Glacier Point Road are closed for the winter
description: Tioga Road (continuation of Highway 120 through the park) and Glacier Point Road are closed for the season due to snow. They usually open around late May or June. Call 209/372-0200 (then 1, 1) for road conditions and tire chain requirements.

title: Water Fountain/Bottle Filling Station Shut Off
description: The water fountains and bottle filling station at the restroom area across from the barn have been shut off for the winter. Toilets still function. Please plan ahead and bring enough water for hiking. Water is available in the visitor center when open.

title: State Route 148 closed for the winter season
description: Visitors can access the park via Highway 143 and the town of Brian Head. You can view Cedar Breaks from the North View Overlook. State Route 143 will remain open, weather permitting.

title: Fire Restrictions Lifted, in place Moderate Fire Danger, Beginning November 25
description: Wood and charcoal fires permitted. Please monitor this website and the park social media pages for the most up to date information as conditions can change rapidly.

title: Jamestown Island Loop Drive Closed for Bridge Rehabilitation Project
description: Colonial National Historical Park will implement a temporary closure of the Jamestown Island Loop Drive beginning on Monday December 2, 2024 to safely rehabilitate three wooden bridges on the drive.

title: Occasional Phone and Internet Issues
description: We are still experiencing occasional ongoing internet and phone outages beyond our control. We remain open and can usually receive calls and email but there may be some delays. If you are trying to reach us, please call 925-812-6164.

title: Trail Closure at Quartermaster Depot Area
description: Due to recent heavy rains, there is a partial closure of the trail system around the Quartermaster Depot until hazard mitigation has been completed for the ruins. When visiting, please stay on the trail, away from ruin walls and obey warnings / closures.

title: Partial Closure due to Carr Fire
description: While most of the park has reopened after the 2018 Carr Fire, some areas are still closed for safety. Please exercise caution when hiking in areas affected by the Carr Fire.

title: Oversized Vehicles are Unable to Park in Visitor Center Parking Lot
description: Due to construction, oversized vehicles will not be allowed to park in the visitor center parking lot due to lack of space and ability to turn-around safely. There is oversized parking along the main park road.

title: Campground Open with Limited Services
description: The campground is open for winter camping. The water is shut off for the season and campers must plan accordingly. Comfort stations are closed and inaccessible. Vault toilets remain available. Campers must walk, bike, or snowshoe in to access campground.

title: Landslide at Colville Flats on Friday, November 17, 2024
description: Landslide caused a large displacement wave on Lake Roosevelt. Water washed over HWY 25 north of Colville Flats. This led to an increase in debris in the lake that will float downstream in the coming days. The land is still moving and unstable. Use caution

title: Visitor Center Construction May Impact Visitor Experience
description: A new visitor center is currently under construction and may impact park visitors. Visit the link below for the most up to date information.

title: Staff Unable to Check Phone Messages
description: At this time, staff are unable to check phone messages left at the visitor center. Please email the park at moca_tuzi_info@nps.gov if you need to contact the park.

title: State Route 20 Closed for the Season
description: State Route 20 is closed at milepost 134 (Ross Dam Trailhead) for the season due to heavy snowfall and risk of avalanche danger. Check the WSDOT real time map for up-to-date information, https://wsdot.com/Travel/Real-time/Map/.

title: Beat the Heat
description: Make sure to take hot weather into consideration. Carry water and use sunscreen to reduce the risk of heat injuries during your visit.

title: Rip Currents and Rough Surf
description: Remember that rough surf is dangerous & rip currents can be deadly. Please use caution when swimming at Canaveral National Seashore.

title: Steel Creek Ranger Station Phones Offline
description: Phones are currently down at Steel Creek Ranger Station due to widespread flooding. For park information, please call Tyler Bend Visitor Center at 870-439-2502.

title: Backcountry Trail Conditions
description: GPS is necessary on backcountry trails: Oakridge, River, and Kingsnake. These trails may be difficult to follow. River Trail is not recommended at this time due to the volume of downed trees and debris from recent storms.

title: Charles Pinckney House Closed for the Season
description: The Charles Pinckney House is closed for the season. The site grounds will remain open from 9 AM -- 5 PM, Wednesday -- Sunday.

title: Old East Entrance Station Parking Area Closure
description: The Old East Entrance Station parking area will be closed to visitor traffic for the winter. Coal Vein Road will be the temporary visitor/vehicle turn-around area.

title: Section of the boardwalk is closed
description: Due to safety concerns the section of the boardwalk closest to the cave is closed. The staff are working on a plan to address the situation.

title: Backcountry vehicle route closed for the season
description: The backcountry vehicle route has closed for the season until May 15, 2025. As conditions allow, the route will be maintained as a groomed ski and snowshoe trail from the Cabin District to the horse barn near Cerro Piñon.

title: Flooding/bridge out on the Grand Portage Trail at Poplar Creek
description: Increased rain and beaver dam activity flooded the Poplar Creek Crossing along the Grand Portage Trail, washing out the bridge. Please use caution as you pass. Park staff is in the process of determining a route less prone to flood damage.

title: North Entrance Road and Rim Drive are CLOSED for the season.
description: The North Entrance Road and East & West Rim Drives are now closed for the season a few The roads will not open again until mid to late June or July 2025. All other roads are open.

title: Holiday Hours
description: On Thanksgiving Day, Christmas Eve, Christmas Day, and New Year's Day the visitor center will be closed (trails will remain open with access to restrooms on the north side of the building).

title: Cashless Fee Collection Exercise
description: Fort Davis National Historic Site to begin 6-month cashless fee collection exercise starting Monday November 18, 2024. Transition to electronic payments reduces transaction times, saves money, and improves accountability.

title: Please Email if Unable to Reach by Phone
description: Park phones are experiencing technical issues at this time. If unable to reach by phone, please feel free to email cong_information@nps.gov with any questions.

title: Potential delays during stone wall rehabilitation project
description: The stone wall that lines Skyline Drive is being rehabilitated between miles 72.8 and 75.7. There will be a single lane closure for the duration of this work, with an established work zone that will be managed by flaggers. Visitors should expect delays.

title: Adams Memorial temporarily not on view.
description: A protective structure currently covers this outdoor sculpture as preservation efforts proceed in the surrounding landscape. The Shaw/54th Regiment Memorial, Farragut Memorial, and Standing Lincoln are on view during daylight hours.

title: Highway 180 Access To Cedar Grove Area of Kings Canyon National Park Closed For the Season
description: Highway 180 is closed east of Hume Lake Road for the winter season. Cedar Grove is not accessible. This section of road typically reopens in late April.

title: Bumpass Hell Trail Closed For Season
description: 11/12/2024 - Due to recent snowfall, the Bumpass Hell Trail has closed for the season. This is an annual closure to prevent injury from treacherous trail conditions near hydrothermal areas.

title: No Gasoline is Available in the Park
description: The gas pumps at Mazama Village are CLOSED for the season. Please plan ahead and fill up your tank before heading to the park.

title: Service Road Closure
description: The walkway toward the lighthouse is closed to due construction of the roadway. Please do not enter the area.

title: Fishing Creek Bridge Closed - May Cause Delay
description: The Fishing Creek Bridge will be closed on Monday, November 11, 2024, until further notice. All visitors will need to take the alternate route on the Cumberland Parkway at Exit 78 and head east on KY-Highway 80 towards Nancy.

title: Part of Fort Totten Park remains closed for public safety
description: Out of an abundance of caution, Fort Totten Park will remain closed east of Fort Totten Drive, south of Gallatin Street/Metropolitan Branch Trail and north of Brookland Ave NE/Farragut St. due to the investigation involving two WWI-era munitions found.

title: Part of Fort Totten Park remains closed for public safety
description: Out of an abundance of caution, Fort Totten Park will remain closed east of Fort Totten Drive, south of Gallatin Street/Metropolitan Branch Trail and north of Brookland Ave NE/Farragut St. due to the investigation involving two WWI-era munitions found.

title: Fee Changes beginning in January 2025
description: Beginning January 1, 2025, the National Park Service (NPS) at Lake Roosevelt National Recreation Area will increase camping and boat launch fees and introduce a new dump station/water fill fee.

title: Wheeler Peak Scenic Drive Winter Closure
description: The Wheeler Peak Scenic Drive is closed at mile 3, Upper Lehman Creek Campground, for the winter season. For information on other closures, click more...

title: Rehabilitation of Colonial Parkway continues with additional Parkway closures
description: Beginning Tuesday, April 9, 2024, construction will close the Colonial Parkway to all travel in either direction between Yorktown and VA Route 199. Follow all detour signs. See additional closure information in the link below.

title: Cascade River Road Seasonal Closure
description: Cascade River Road is closed for the season at Eldorado (milepost 20). Check the road conditions page for more information.

title: New Mexico Road Advisories
description: The New Mexico Department of Transportation updates its map of road advisories regularly. Visitors are encouraged to look for any possible road advisories along their route of travel beforehand.

title: Thaddeus Kosciuszko National Memorial Closed for the Season
description: Check back in Spring 2025 for a reopening date.

title: Kirby Storter - Partial Reopen
description: As of 11/4/2024, the Kirby Storter Boardwalk will reopen to the public. Note that the boardwalk is only open part of the way, as rebuilding has not yet begun.

title: Historic Homes Closed for Winter Season
description: The historic homes are closed for the winter season and unavailable for tours. The 2025 tour season is anticipated to begin late spring/early summer. The Visitor Center at 1250 Hancock St., Quincy, is open 11am-4pm Monday-Friday, except federal holidays.

title: Pierce Stocking Scenic Drive Winter & Spring Vehicle Road Closure
description: This road is closed to vehicles. It remains open to foot traffic. The seasonal reopening date is determined by the amount of sand, hazard trees, and debris that will need to be cleaned up or moved after winter storms. This is typically in mid-May.

title: Baltimore Area Traffic Advisory
description: Traffic in the Baltimore area has increased considerably in recent months due to the collapse of the Francis Scott Key Bridge which connected the Baltimore beltway. Please check the latest traffic conditions to plan your travel accordingly.

title: Sat & Sun IF parking is full, entrance closes, no entrance until parking available.
description: Saturdays & Sundays with good weather, IF our parking lots fill we close the park entrance. (Georgetown Pike & Old Dominion Dr) We re-open when parking is available. No waiting, no street parking. Updates at Great Falls Park Facebook page.

title: Trail Ridge Road is Closed to Through Travel for the Season
description: Trail Ridge Road (U.S. Hwy 34) is closed to vehicles to through travel for the season. Trail Ridge Road is closed on the east side of the park at Many Parks Curve and on the west side of the park at Colorado River Trailhead.

title: Weir House, Weir Studio, Young Studio, Visitor Center, and Restrooms Closed
description: Please note starting November 1st all park buildings are closed for the season. Park grounds are open daily year-round and maps, brochures, and passport stamp are available in the parking lot kiosk. Restrooms are not available during the off-season.

title: Mineral King Road Is Closed For the Season
description: The portion of Mineral King Road inside Sequoia National Park is closed for the winter season to the general public. The road typically reopens in May on the Wednesday before Memorial Day, but could be later depending on conditions.

title: Trail Conditions
description: Rain may cause trails to be slick and overgrown. Staff and Volunteer Trail Crews clear trails regularly. Visitors should use caution and report trail issues to viis_interpretation@nps.gov

title: All lava tube caves closed November 1 through April 30
description: All park lava tube caves are closed for the winter from November 1 through April 30 to protect hibernating bats. This closure does not affect the Junction Bridge Cave at the start of El Calderon Trail.

title: Fritch Fortress Restroom Closure
description: Fritch Fortress Restrooms are closed until April 1, 2025 for the winter season.

title: Portion of Kekaulike Avenue in Kula to close for approximately nine months
description: A portion of Kekaulike Avenue (Route 377) between Waiakoa Road and ʻAlae Road will be closed for 24 hours, seven days a week, for approximately nine months.

title: Seasonal Closures
description: Park grounds are open during daylight hours, but park buildings are closed until Memorial Day weekend. Walkways, trails, and grounds are not currently maintained for public use and may be icy, snow-covered, or uneven. Restrooms are not available.

title: Baltimore Area Traffic Advisory
description: Traffic in the Baltimore area has increased considerably in recent months due to the collapse of the Francis Scott Key Bridge which connected the Baltimore beltway. Please check the latest traffic conditions to plan your travel accordingly.

title: Do Not Handle Wildlife
description: If you see a dead bat or a bat acting strangely at the fort, please do not touch or move it. Report the location of the animal to park staff.

title: Seasonal Closures
description: Jumonville Glen, Mount Washington Tavern and the Picnic Area have closed for the season. They will reopen on May 1, 2025!

title: Moat Wall is closed for repairs until Fall 2026
description: The entire moat wall will be closed for repair and strengthening of the Fort Jefferson counterscarp (moat wall) damaged by Hurricane Irma in 2017 and Hurricane Ian in 2022. Additional damage occurred from hurricanes in 2024.

title: Wupatki Pueblo Partial Closure
description: 3 rooms at Wupatki pueblo are closed due to an unstable wall. The trail is fully open.

title: Possible Hazards in Open Sections
description: Parkway areas open after Hurricane Helene may have limited services. Visitors should exercise caution when hiking in or near open areas of the park. Hazards on trails such as landslides, tree debris, and washed-out sections or bridges are possible.(10/23)

title: Miners River Bridge Closed
description: The bridge connecting Miners Castle Road to Miners Beach is closed for a full bridge replacement. Closures will go through spring 2025.

title: Road to Exit Glacier Closed to Automobiles
description: The Alaska Department of Transportation has closed Herman Leirer Road for winter. Therefore, the road to Exit Glacier under the National Park Service is closed as well. Reopening is typically in mid to late-May, with variation due snow and weather.

title: Water in Campground is Shut Off for the Winter
description: Due to overnight freezing temperatures, water in the campground has been shut off for the season. Visitors should plan to bring their own water. Small containers may be filled at the visitor center during business hours.

title: Closed Tuesdays and Wednesdays effective Oct 20
description: Winter hours begin on October 20, 2024: the visitor center and park trails will be open five days a week, from Thursday through Monday. Closed on Tuesdays and Wednesdays. There is no trail access when the visitor center is closed.

title: Temporary Number Change
description: The park's phone number has temporarily changed. Please call 434-694-8904.

title: Site Access
description: Be aware in your planning that I-40 in NC and I-26 in TN have been compromised due to the effects of Hurricane Helene. In addition, the Erwin Hwy (107) bridge leading into Greeneville was destroyed and is not expected to reopen until sometime in 2025.

title: Help Prevent Aquatic Invasive Species (AIS) Infestation
description: A number of lakes are infested with an array of aquatic invasive species that damage natural ecosystems and waterways. Boaters are advised to Clean, Drain, and Dry all boats and equipment every time they leave the water.

title: No Water Available
description: Water systems throughout the park are shut off for the winter season. Plan ahead and bring all drinking water.

title: No Potable Water in Park Campgrounds
description: There currently is no water available in any campground in Great Basin National Park.  Water is available at the Lehman Caves Visitor Center, Great Basin Visitor Center, and local businesses.

title: All facilities are closed for the season
description: The newly constructed Visitor Contact Station, Zion Forever Park Store, and Human History Museum are closed for the winter season and will not reopen until snow conditions subside in the 2025 spring season.

title: Beware of Harmful Algal Blooms
description: Harmful Algal Blooms have been spotted on Lake Powell. If you suspect a harmful algal bloom, stay out of the water and avoid any contact with water or scums if you see pale-green or pea-green scum on or in the water. Read more at the link

title: Visitor Phone Line Intermittent
description: You may experience problems reaching park staff via the main visitor phone line which functions intermittently. You may email the park at lavo_information@nps.gov with general park questions.

title: Maurice Stephens Parking Lot Closed During Construction Project
description: The parking lot near the Maurice Stephens house, located on Rt 23 opposite from the Washington Memorial Chapel, is closed during construction and renovation work on the house. Visitors are encouraged to park in the Chapel lot for Grand Parade trail access

title: Please Use Caution at the Truman Farm While Visiting---Preservation Work Underway
description: A special project to restore the foundation of the Truman Farm Home has begun. Construction has begun and will continue through December. Please be mindful of your surroundings. This work will ensure preservation of the structure for future generations.

title: Due to flooding access points to Bluestone National Scenic River are closed
description: All access points to the park are currently closed. The road through Bluestone State Park and the Lilly access are currently closed due to flooding. Parts of the Bluestone Turnpike Trail may be flooded.

title: Phones Working Intermittently
description: As of 9/30/2024 our phone lines are working intermittently. If you are not able to reach us by phone, please email us at bela_information@nps.gov.

title: Box Canyon Day Use Area Closed
description: Due to the recent illegal lighting of a fire in the trash bin, the theft of government signs, and the unauthorized movement of barricades to drive into an area closed to vehicle traffic, the metal gate at the upper end of Box Canyon has now been closed.

title: Main Visitor Center Closed
description: Our main visitor center (VC) is closed due to ongoing construction, a temporary VC has been set up across the parking lot. The movie and museum are unavailable at this time, everything else is available inside the temporary VC.

title: Migrant Notice
description: Like elsewhere in the Florida Keys, we have seen an increase in Cuban migrants arriving by boat from Cuba and landing on the islands of Dry Tortugas National Park. You may observe migrant landings at the park and visitor areas may be impacted.

title: Expect Crowding
description: Parking lots and popular destinations are crowded especially on weekends and days with warm weather between 10 am and 3 pm.

title: Current East Rim Trail Status
description: Click "more" to find out if the East Rim trails are open today. In good conditions the trails are open 6 am-11 pm for bikers and as posted for other trail users. In wet or hazardous conditions, the trail will close to all users to prevent damage.
